ProjectName: Redevelopment of Scott Base - Antarctica
ProjectShortDescription: This project is to redevelop Scott Base into a safe fit for purpose facility to support evolving science needs for the next 50 years. The Scott Base Redevelopment Detailed Business Case (completed December 2018) has been endorsed by Cabinet. Antarctica New Zealand has received $18.5 million in Budget 2019 to develop an Implementation Business Case. The Implementation Business Case will go to Cabinet for endorsement in approximately September 2021. Antarctica New Zealand are utilising an Early Contractor Involvement contract with procurement for a construction partner starting with Registrations of Interest in September 2019.

ProjectShortDescription: This project requires remediation of urgent infrastructure at Auckland City Hospital and Greenlane Clinical Centre to address high risk of service failure (as evidenced by detailed infrastructure assessments undertaken).

ProjectName: Integrated Stroke Unit -Auckland City Hospital
ProjectShortDescription: This project is a refurbishment of administration space into clinical space for an Integrated Stroke Unit. It includes an expansion of beds on Level 5 at Auckland City Hospital.

ProjectName: New Mental Health Services Facilities and Relocation from Princess Margaret Hospital
ProjectShortDescription: This project requires investment in new facilities to enable the relocation of the following mental health services from the Princess Margaret Hospital campus: Mothers and babies and eating disorder regional inpatient and outpatient services; Child Adolescent and Family inpatient and outpatient services; and Specialist Rehabilitation inpatient unit (Seager Clinic).

ProjectName: Individualised Service Units for High Risk Mental Health and Intellectual Disability Clients
ProjectShortDescription: This project will deliver a facility for new service for clients with severe mental health intellectual disability diagnoses.

ProjectName: Manukau Infrastructure for New Capacity
ProjectShortDescription: This project will deliver critical infrastructure needed to support relocation and expansion of clinical services planned in short/medium term on Manukau site. This includes new plant room/substations; heating ventilation and air conditioning; medical gases, information technology; parking; and other essential infrastructure.

ProjectName: Manukau Radiology Hub - Stage 1
ProjectShortDescription: This project will establish a radiology hub at the Manukau site to improve service delivery and efficiency (currently the absence of CT and MRI services requires patients to be transferred to Middlemore or an additional diagnostic visit). Radiology access will include the range of elective patients suitable for the Manukau site.

ProjectName: Re-clad of three clinical buildings - Stage 1 - Counties Manukau
ProjectShortDescription: This project will re-clad three clinical buildings: Kids First and McIndoe ambulance bay; Manukau Elective Surgery Hospital; and Middlemore Hospital McIndoe Building. These will be re-clad sequentially due to high clinical occupancy and lack of decanting space.

ProjectName: Radiology Relocation to Harley Gray  Middlemore Hospital
ProjectShortDescription: This project will relocate existing radiology department from the earthquake prone Galbraith building (20 at IL4) to the Harley Gray building which was designed to accommodate the clinical areas for Radiology.

ProjectName: Critical Capacity Works and New Laboratory - Stage 1 - Whangarei Hospital
ProjectShortDescription: This project will deliver interim capacity for theatres and endoscopy ahead of major redevelopment at Whangarei Hospital. It will also introduce a new service by building an interim Cardiac Catheter Laboratory at Whangarei Hospital ahead of major redevelopment.

ProjectName: Bay of Islands Hospital Rebuild - Stage 2
ProjectShortDescription: This project is stage two of the rebuild of Bay of Islands Hospital and will incorporate a primary care clinic; outpatient space; and shared reception. This work was originally going to be undertaken by a Trust but was not progressed as the Trust was unable to get finance.

ProjectName: Dunedin Hospital Site Clearance
ProjectShortDescription: This project is the demolition and early works of the New Dunedin Hospital Campus.

ProjectName: New Dunedin Hospital - Stage 1 & 2
ProjectShortDescription: This project requires that a New Dunedin Hospital campus is built across the ex-Cadbury and Wilson blocks in central Dunedin to replace hospital services currently provided in the Clinical Services Block, Ward Block (acute clinical services; birthing; inpatient units; clinical and non-clinical support services; and ambulatory services) and an Energy Centre.

ProjectName: New Dunedin Hospital Campus
ProjectShortDescription: This project requires that a New Dunedin Hospital campus is built across the ex-Cadbury and Wilson blocks in central Dunedin to replace hospital services currently provided in the Clinical Services Block, Ward Block (acute clinical services; birthing; inpatient units; clinical and non-clinical support services; and ambulatory services) and an Energy Centre. This follows on from the New Dunedin Hospital Stage 1 & 2 project.

ProjectName: Elective Capacity and Inpatient Beds and Supporting Infrastructure
ProjectShortDescription: This project will deliver additional capacity in elective theatres; inpatient beds; and endoscopy suite and centralised sterile services department for Waitemata District Health Board to meet immediate and short-term future capacity requirements. The current bed deficit for Waitemata District Health Board is 40 and this will increase to approximately 111 by 2025. The proposal from Waitemata District Health Board includes 115 beds; four theatres; and four procedure rooms.

ProjectName: Taxiway Alpha Extension
ProjectShortDescription: Taxi-way Alpha needs to be extended to improve the safety of aircraft manoeuvres. The scope of this extension is yet to be determined.

ProjectName: Air Movements Unit Hangar and Equipment Storage
ProjectShortDescription: There is a requirement to enhance the ability to effectively and safely store; manage; and re-pack items pre- and post- flights. Currently undertaken in or around the air-movements area enhancements would include a covered; environmentally controlled; and securable area.

ProjectName: Arch Hangar Mid-life Light Refit
ProjectShortDescription: The Arch-Hangars used by Airforce in Whenuapai were built during the early 1940's. They require a refit of the associated hangar components - fire-suppression; fume extraction; lighting; environmental conditions; heating and cooling; electrical wiring and plumbing.

ProjectName: Arch Hangar Mid-life Intensive Refit
ProjectShortDescription: The Arch-Hangars used by Airforce in Whenuapai were built during the early 1940's. They require a refit of the associated hangar components - fire-suppression; fume extraction; lighting; environmental conditions; heating and cooling; electrical wiring and plumbing. It is likely that more intensive work will also be required. It is possible that this will include a re-roof and possibly concrete remediation.

ProjectName: Runway End Safety Area (03-21)
ProjectShortDescription: This project will satisfy requirements to upgrade and improve the runway safety area to cater for existing and future aircraft. The exact scope of this work has yet to be defined.

ProjectName: Future Air Mobility Fixed Wing Simulator Utilities Enablement
ProjectShortDescription: The Future Air Mobility Capability Simulator Building will be sited on an agreed and pre-determined location. Underground facilities will need to be brought into this site to support that facility. It is likely that a general upgrade of connected services will arise due to the age and limited capacity and condition of the existing services.

ProjectName: Explosive Processing Facility
ProjectShortDescription: This project will deliver improvements to the explosive processing facility to ensure compliance with the New Zealand Defence Force Hazardous Substance Safety Requirements. Improvements to this facility must ensure regulatory compliance while considering and provisioning for future operating needs. Elements of the facility are listed on the Asbestos Register and are likely to require remediation. Note: The countermeasures (chaff and flare) used by SH-2G(I) Seasprite; C-130H Hercules; and the Future Air Mobility Capability platform will continue to require an explosives preparation area in the future.

ProjectName: Future Air Mobility Fixed Wing Simulator Facility
ProjectShortDescription: This project seeks to deliver a fixed-wing full motion simulator facility and associated services. This will enable the training and preparation for the Future Air Mobility Capability airframe scheduled to be based at Whenuapai. This project should be located adjacent to associated facilities and unit headquarters. The project definition and requirements will be driven by concept design and specific equipment specifications.

ProjectName: Linked Capability Base Infrastructure Support Requirements
ProjectShortDescription: This project is a 'catch-all' for the general upgrade of underground services across major areas of Whenuapai and will be prioritised in accordance with established understanding of the relative priority for: type; nature; condition; and requirement of the underground service (its future location and extent of work required).

ProjectName: Linked Capability of Airfield Infrastructure
ProjectShortDescription: This project is a 'catch-all' for the general upgrade of 'airfield infrastructure' as is required to meet capability requirements, for Whenuapai and will be prioritised in accordance with established understanding of capability requirements.

ProjectName: Existing Wharf Strengthening - Future Maritime Fleet
ProjectShortDescription: This project entry remains as a placeholder awaiting confirmation of requirement from the Defence Capability project lead. The scope and detailed requirements of the project will be determined by a subsequent report and requirements of the future maritime fleet.

ProjectName: Small Boats Storage and Wash Down Area
ProjectShortDescription: This project will provide a fit for purpose storage and wash down facility replacing the current (outdoor) small boat storage area. The aim of this is to provide a facility which will protect the small boats from sea spray; sun; wind; and rain; and enable easy transfer of boats into and out of the facility. It is intended that the building will remain open to the North East. The facility will provide the ability to remove salt and other contaminants from the boats in a manner which meets legislative safety and environmental requirements; enable routine general maintenance including minor maintenance on the engines; and to store ready use items and related maintenance equipment. Physical security i.e. lockable areas and oversight/monitoring will likely be a requirement.

ProjectName: Small Boats Maintenance Workshop
ProjectShortDescription: This project seeks to provide a safe working environment for maintenance activities related to the small boat fleet. Physical security i.e. lockable areas and oversight/monitoring will likely be a requirement.

ProjectName: Small Boats Fuel Services
ProjectShortDescription: This project seeks to provide safe fuelling options for the small boat fleet. This will include the controls; monitoring; and environmental protection measures required to support safe fuelling suitable for the current and future small-boat fleets.

ProjectName: Waterside Operations and Offices
ProjectShortDescription: This project will deliver a multi-use; combined-use; office; planning; conference; and training building for the management of all ship related dock-side operations (maintenance and management) and all ship related water-side operations (supply; management; and support).

ProjectName: Transitionary Multi-Purpose Office Accommodation
ProjectShortDescription: This project requires the delivery of a transitional suite of general office-like areas. The Naval Base is constrained geographically and will require a transitional suite of general office-like areas that cater for dislocated functions and personnel while their facility is replaced. It is envisaged that this suite of office-like areas be temporary; modular; demountable; and removable on there being no further use. It is envisaged that the facility will receive multiple groups over a number of years.

ProjectName: Linked Capability Wharf Extension

ProjectName: Ocean Patrol Vessel Wharf Transformer

ProjectName: Combined Explosive Hazards Security and Noise Buffer
ProjectShortDescription: This project is a placeholder to support the requirements of the Combined Explosive Hazards programme for working dogs at either Papakura; Ardmore; or Linton. The scope and detailed requirements seek the support of additional dogs and general improvements required for the training facilities at the relevant site. The level of noise attenuation required will be dependent on the surrounding environment. The full scope and scale of the project will be determined in line with the capability requirements and this units foreseen needs.

ProjectName: Special Operations Vehicle Introduction to Service - Priority Roads and Entrance
ProjectShortDescription: This project entry and project title awaits confirmation of requirement from the Defence Capability project lead. This project seeks upgrades to specific heavy vehicle routes in order to ensure safe and efficient vehicular movements in line with the expected future vehicle fleet demands. This project entry remains as a placeholder.

ProjectName: Secure Compound Extension
ProjectShortDescription: This project will deliver an extension to the secure compound at Papakura Camp. The secure compound at Papakura Camp requires extension to enable operational equipment to be trafficked and stored securely within the expanded compound. This project will also include associated roading; security monitoring; and other electronic security requirements. The spatial arrangement of these developments will be in line with the Papakura Infrastructure Master Plan.

ProjectName: North East Quadrant Flight Line Support
ProjectShortDescription: This project requires the delivery of facilities to support Air Surveillance Maritime Patrol Aircraft. With the introduction of fixed wing aircraft to the North East Quadrant new or co-joint facilities are required to support the capabilities and requirements of Air Surveillance Maritime Patrol aircraft. This project seeks to meet the demands of the Air Surveillance Maritime Patrol requirements without duplicating facilities. This may include maintenance and immediate logistics support that is required to be located within the North East Quadrant (i.e. behind the flight line at North East Quadrant). Functions are to be located and consolidated to meet the contemporary precinct block plan.

ProjectName: Fixed Wing Training and Simulation Facility
ProjectShortDescription: This project will deliver a new facility. The Air Surveillance Maritime Patrol training and simulation building is required to support and enable the introduction of this new capability at Ohakea. The building facilities must enable a capacity of approximately 60 personnel concurrently with associated administration; ablutions; and storage space to meet the security classification of the material and equipment. This facility will require secure communications and sufficient power capacity to support equipment and heating and cooling requirements. Due to other facilities in the vicinity separate and duplicated large break-out spaces are not foreseen. Easy and safe access to other associated squadron facilities will therefore need to be considered. This complex is not required to be located on the flight-line.

ProjectName: Fixed Wing Warehouse and Parts Storage
ProjectShortDescription: This project may require an expansion/upgrade of existing facilities and surrounding infrastructure at Ohakea. To support and enable the introduction of new capability (Air Surveillance Maritime Patrol) at Ohakea platform specific parts require storage. A functional assessment of the storage needs will determine how this is provided. This is likely to be a mix of expansion/upgrade of existing Ohakea storage facilities and providing first-line parts storage close to the squadron facilities. This may also require upgrades to surrounding infrastructure to enable efficient processing and transportation of these parts and maintain security requirements.

ProjectName: Fuel Storage Facility Expansion
ProjectShortDescription: This project will deliver an expansion of the existing fuel storage facility. The existing fuel storage facility is to be expanded commensurate with the demands of (among other things) the introduction into Royal New Zealand Air Force Base Ohakea of the Air Surveillance Maritime Patrol aircraft with an aviation refueller and expanded and improved tanker park.

ProjectName: Air Surveillance Complimentary Capability Operations Centre
ProjectShortDescription: This project is a placeholder to support the introduction into service of the Air Surveillance Complimentary Capability fleet. The scope and scale of this project yet to be determined and may involve a new or improving an existing facility.

ProjectName: Air Surveillance Complimentary Capability Hangar and Apron
ProjectShortDescription: This project is a placeholder to support the introduction into service of the Air Surveillance Complimentary Capability fleet. The scope and scale of this project is as yet unknown but is likely to re-use and improve an existing hangar and improve the condition of apron facilities.

ProjectName: Investment in Ohakea Housing
ProjectShortDescription: This project will replace existing housing at Ohakea. Ohakea is expecting an increase in on-base military personnel. The existing Ohakea housing is old and inefficient. A requirement exists to replace existing housing and provide new purpose-designed housing that is higher density and fit for contemporary use. New housing will be designed to remain relatable to occupiers for 50 years.

ProjectName: Double Hangar and Offices
ProjectShortDescription: This project will deliver a new hangar. The introduction of the new P8-A aircraft will require a new hangar located in the north east quadrant.

ProjectName: Operational Unit Precinct Utilities including High Voltage
ProjectShortDescription: This project is a placeholder to support the infrastructure upgrades required as a consequence of intensified development within the Operational Precinct at Linton Camp. Additional reports will inform the full scale and association of this project in view of the linked capability requirements.

ProjectName: Protected Mobility Vehicle Introduction to Service - Priority Roads and Heavy Goods Entrance
ProjectShortDescription: This project is a placeholder to support the introduction into service of the future Protected Mobility Vehicle fleet. The scope and scale of this project is currently unknown as it is dependent on the selected platform (yet to be decided). New Zealand Defence Force must ensure its camps and bases remain operationally effective and this project seeks to deliver improvements to the significant roads (to meet initial operating capability) required by the Protected Mobility Vehicle fleet at Linton consequential to their size and mass; without upgrades the next generation Protected Mobility Vehicle fleet may cause significant damage to existing road networks. This project also requires the development of the Heavy Goods entrance to enable efficient access for larger vehicles and provide safe access to and from the Camp.

ProjectName: Protected Mobility Vehicle Introduction to Service - Priority Hardstanding
ProjectShortDescription: This project is a placeholder to support the introduction into service of the Protected Mobility Fleet. As the project is dependent on the selected platform(s) the scale and requirements of this upgrade are currently unknown. The New Zealand Defence Force must ensure its camps and bases remain operationally effective, and this project seeks to deliver improvements to the hard-standing requirements to meet initial operating capability of the future Protected Mobility Vehicle fleet. As larger and heavier vehicles are anticipated this project will likely consist of upgrading and provision of new hard-standing. The location and hard-standing will meet the intent of the contemporary master and precinct block plans.

ProjectName: Operational Fuels Infrastructure - Logistics Precinct
ProjectShortDescription: This project will deliver upgrades to the operational fuels facility. The current operational fuels facility is not compliant due to changes in legislation; industry best practice; and changes in New Zealand Defence Force equipment fleets. The existing facility is now over 25 years old and is limited in both parking and fuel capacity to accommodate the range of fuelling equipment currently in service. This results in vehicles being parked without adequate secondary containment to manage a rupture or leak. This project seeks to provide these upgrades to prevent interceptors becoming overwhelmed; bypassed; or causing ground contamination.

ProjectName: Medical Centre and Hospital Relocation
ProjectShortDescription: This project intends to provide a compliant, fit for purpose medical centre to enable the provision of quality health services to Linton personnel. The facility is to be located within the health precinct in order to ensure efficiencies and adjacencies with key units and users. This medical centre will meet the contemporary requirements of New Zealand Defence Force and will seek to reduce the duplication of shared spaces (such as waiting rooms) through co-location with similar functions.

ProjectName: Stormwater Network - Logistics Precinct
ProjectShortDescription: This project involve stormwater and drainage reticulation works. Stormwater and drainage reticulation needs to be complete to meet the Logistics precinct re-development and to accommodate future projected stormwater flows consequential to the concentration of catchment areas. Currently there are some issues with stormwater flooding and poor drainage in this area. This is likely to worsen as increasing rainfall events occur. Attenuation ponds are required between the proposed Regional Supply Facility and watercourse re-alignment culvert. These stormwater and ecological improvements are required in order to maintain operational effectiveness whilst providing for a future-proofed resilient site.

ProjectName: Waterway - Common Logistic Precinct
ProjectShortDescription: This project involves stormwater and drainage reticulation works. Stormwater and drainage reticulation need to be complete to meet the Logistics precinct re-development and to accommodate future projected stormwater flows consequential to the concentration of catchment areas. Currently there are some issues with storm-water flooding and poor drainage in this area. This is likely to worsen as increasing rainfall events occur. Attenuation ponds are required between the proposed Regional Supply Facility and watercourse re-alignment culvert. These stormwater and ecological improvements are required in order to maintain operational effectiveness whilst providing for a future-proofed resilient site.

ProjectName: Consolidated Parking - Common Logistics Precinct
ProjectShortDescription: This project requires the development of centralised parking at Linton Camp. Responding to the emerging New Zealand Defence Force parking strategy and the requirement to centralise and consolidate assets the Linton Infrastructure Master Plan indicated the requirement to consolidate parking across Linton Camp into central locations. Centralised parking provision is critical to the development of the Linton common logistics area; ensuring separation between pedestrians; personal vehicles; and heavy vehicles. This car park is to be designed to enable efficient access and designed in line with contemporary sustainable and landscaping practices and responding to anticipated changed in vehicle design and usage patterns.

ProjectName: Heavy Vehicle Entrance Gate
ProjectShortDescription: This project seeks to provide security enhancements associated with the increased heavy vehicle movements at a purpose-built heavy vehicle entrance and goods-interchange at Linton Camp. This project will likely require completion of the significant works associated with the Consolidated Logistics Programme at Linton Camp. On completion this project will enable effective entrance control; increase heavy vehicle movement efficiency; and reduce impact to the local road connection.

ProjectName: Camp Security and Entrance Enhancements
ProjectShortDescription: This project will develop the main entry to Camp. The current set up of the main entry to Camp is inadequate for the safe and efficient management of entrance into Camp by both pedestrians and vehicles. There is a requirement to enhance the security measures; primarily to improve security of pedestrians; and to create an enhanced controllable area for vehicle management purposes.

ProjectName: Medical Centre Burnham
ProjectShortDescription: This project intends to provide a compliant fit for purpose medical centre which is required to enable the provision of quality health services to Burnham personnel. The facility is to be located within the Health and wellbeing precinct as directed by the Burnham Infrastructure Master Plan. This project is a key dependency for the store's facility (i.e. is a predecessor) shown within the Logistics Precinct Block Plan.

ProjectName: Electrical Network Priority
ProjectShortDescription: This project seeks to provide a reliable electrical network at Burnham Camp. The existing transformers are at end of life and safety concerns are arising from the effect of the age and condition and also demands through network distribution. These priority upgrades will accommodate known future demands and it is intended to utilise existing service corridors where appropriate but may necessitate a rationalised arterial and secondary service corridor layout. These upgrades will respond to and support the revised Camp layout as directed by the Burnham Infrastructure Master Plan.

ProjectName: Camp Armoury
ProjectShortDescription: This project will extend the existing armoury to meet current and future capacity requirements. The existing armoury does not meet current nor future expected capacity requirements and requires upgrades in order to store contemporary weaponry. This project will likely result in an extension to the existing armoury and will consider uprated management changes to improve efficiencies of stock control. The existing armoury was built to accommodate an extension however this project will support wider improvements especially regarding accessibility and stock management efficiency improvements.

ProjectName: Training Hub - Linked Capability
ProjectShortDescription: The Training Hub at Burnham seeks to co-locate significant training activities to support the outcomes of the Master Plan (2019). The Training Hub will consist of multi-purpose facilities to support the requirements of the proposed relocation of Army Recruit; Non-Commissioned Officer; and Initial Officer Training; including the associated messing needs. This development will enable the concurrent unit operation and training whilst sharing some core facilities. The Training Hub will be located as directed by the master plan.

ProjectName: Facilities Maintenance Compound - Linked Capability
ProjectShortDescription: This project requires relocating the Facilities Maintenance compound at Burnham. As a consequence of detailed planning for Logistics at Burnham the Facilities Maintenance compound is required to be relocated. This activity will include remediation of the existing site and provision of safe and compliant storage of effects to support the needs of infrastructure maintenance activities on the site.

ProjectName: Transport Headquarters
ProjectShortDescription: This project requires relocating the Transport Headquarters at Burnham. As a consequence of detailed planning for Logistics at Burnham the Transport Headquarters are required to be relocated. The existing facilities are also end-of life and significantly constrained. This project will enable a new fit-for-purpose facility for the operation and management of Transport functions.

ProjectName: Fuel Point Logistics
ProjectShortDescription: This project seeks to upgrade the existing fuel point facility principally to enlarge the concrete hard-standing apron size; containment area and volume; and canopy area. The proposed extension will extend parallel to Avery Road. The specific contamination risk of ground water penetration from spillage will be reduced through an appropriate; compliant; and sensitive design.

ProjectName: Network Enabled Army Supporting Infrastructure - Stage 3
ProjectShortDescription: This project is a placeholder to support Stage 3 of the roll-out of the Network Enabled Army. The project has been identified and timed to support the improvement of electrical infrastructure necessary to support the project build phase. The scope and detailed requirements of the project will be determined by a subsequent report and requirement definition.

ProjectName: Investment in Horizontal Infrastructure
ProjectShortDescription: This project requires the relocation; extension; and removal of redundant infrastructure. Defence has a requirement to generally improve the condition; capacity; and resilience of its underground infrastructure. With the intended development of the Defence estate opportunity will be taken to relocate; extend; and remove redundant underground infrastructure. Reports are held pointing to what is required and these will be used along with demands from development to arrange an annual programme of works.

ProjectName: Counter Measures Introduction to Service - Equipment Storage
ProjectShortDescription: This project seeks to support the Introduction to Service of the Electronic Counter Measures Fleet. The scale and requirements remain dependent on the selected platform and until this is known the scope and scale remains unknown. This project seeks to provide the required equipment and spares storage for the specific platform. The expectation is that any facility expansion or upgrades will meet foreseen future needs of the future Electronic Counter Measures Fleet. These facilities will be co-located with similar functions on the site. The location is to be confirmed.

ProjectName: Hospital Boiler Plant - Demolish and Replace
ProjectShortDescription: The Boiler Plant boilers are at end of life and require significant and increasing maintenance costs to maintain their operation. Failures are frequent and the resulting outage times to repair are extending. The building housing the boilers has seismic resilience issues which this project seeks to remediate. This project ties in with the heating and energy plan and subsequent upgrades currently under review for Burnham. This project may be folded into or become redundant because of the Burnham Energy project. This project will be under review as the Energy Project scope is confirmed.

ProjectName: Offshore Patrol Vessels Introduction to Service - Wharf Utilities
ProjectShortDescription: This project seeks to support the introduction to service of new Offshore Patrol Vessels (OPV). This project has been identified as a support improvement to wharf infrastructure necessitated by this capability acquisition. The scope and detailed requirements of the project will be determined by a subsequent report coupled to the requirements of the future maritime fleet.

ProjectName: Protected Mobility Vehicle High Mobility Light Storage - Equipment and Maintenance Support
ProjectShortDescription: This project seeks to support the introduction into service of the future Protected Mobility Vehicle fleet, specifically High Mobility Light. The scale and requirements remain dependent on the selected platform and until this is known the scope and scale remains unknown. This project seeks to provision the required equipment and spares storage for the specific platform and foreseen future needs of the future Protected Mobility Vehicle Fleet. These facilities will be co-located with similar functions on the site.

ProjectName: Protected Mobility Vehicle Utility Vehicle  Medium Infrastructure
ProjectShortDescription: This project seeks to support Introduction to Service of the future Protected Mobility fleet, specifically termed Utility Vehicle - Medium. The scale and requirements remain dependent on the selected platform and until this is known the scope and scale remains unknown. This project seeks to provision the required infrastructure for the specific platform and foreseen future needs of the future Protected Mobility Vehicle fleet. These facilities will be co-located with similar functions on the site.

ProjectName: Safety Improvements - Stage 2 - SH5: Wairakei to Mihi to SH38
ProjectShortDescription: This project involves safety improvements to respond to the National Safety Roads and Roadsides Programme (NSRRP) Business Case. The business case recommended safety treatments target three high risk areas to achieve consistent wide shoulders and a safe and appropriate speed of 100 kilometres per hour.

ProjectName: Safety Improvements (Visiting Driver Signature Project) - Otago
ProjectShortDescription: This project is to implement safety improvements to the Otago road network to create safer roads for tourist drivers on key links. The project forms part of the Safe System Signature Programme under the New Zealand Safer Journeys strategy. The project improves the Otago sections of the following key links Queenstown to Milford; Queenstown to the West Coast; Queenstown to Christchurch. Safety improvements include installing audio tactile profiled road markings and improving barriers. It also includes improving pull-off areas.

ProjectName: Safer Corridor Improvements  Stage 3  SH3 Awakino to Mount Messenger Corridor
ProjectShortDescription: This project will deliver Safer Corridor treatments such as median and side barriers; roundabouts or grade separation and/or speed management. All these treatments are within Safe System (harm minimisation) limits.

ProjectName: New State Highway Construction - Te Ahu a Turanga: Manawatu Tararua Highway
ProjectShortDescription: This project is to replace the closed SH3 Manawatu Gorge route with a new bypass route. The new route will connect the Manawatu and Tararua District along with the Hawkes Bay and north Wairarapa.

ProjectName: Cycle Connection - Hamilton to Cambridge
ProjectShortDescription: This project is the construction of a new off-road shared use path between Hamilton and Cambridge to provide a safe route for walkers and cyclists.

ProjectName: Safety Improvements - SH1 Dome Valley
ProjectShortDescription: This project will introduce a combination of median barrier (9km) and wide centreline (5km) treatment along the full length of the corridor. It also includes 14km of side barriers and replacement of 2.4km side barriers at shoulder widening sections.

ProjectName: Safety Improvements - SH2 Waihi to Omokoroa (Trig Road to Omokoroa)
ProjectShortDescription: This project includes corridor safety treatments as part of the SH2 Waihi to Tauranga (W2T) Programme Business Case.

ProjectName: Safety Improvements - SH2 Waihi to Omokoroa (Waihi to Trig Road)
ProjectShortDescription: This project includes corridor safety treatments as part of the SH2 Waihi to Tauranga (W2T) Programme Business Case.

ProjectName: Makokomuka Stream Bridge Realignment - SH35
ProjectShortDescription: The project will address the ongoing maintenance and resilience as well as other inefficiencies associated with two single lane bridges and one dual lane bridge.

ProjectName: SH3 Awakino Tunnel Bypass
ProjectShortDescription: This project will bypass the single lane Awakino Tunnel on SH3 in south-west Waikato between Hamilton and New Plymouth. This project is part of the Accelerated Regional Roading Package.

ProjectName: Old Mangere Bridge Replacement - Manukau Harbour
ProjectShortDescription: This project is the replacement of the Old Mangere bridge in Manukau. The New Zealand Transport Agency is replacing the Old Mangere Bridge with a new and improved bridge that will reflect what made the existing bridge a much-loved and long-standing community asset while creating an iconic new landmark for the area.

ProjectName: Capacity Improvements  Phase 2 - SH30 Eastern Corridor Rotorua
ProjectShortDescription: This project is to improve capacity along the SH30 eastern corridor in Rotorua.

ProjectName: Enhancing Resilience of SH1 - Stage 2 - Katiki Coast
ProjectShortDescription: Resilience improvements will be made for high risk erosion sites which have been identified along the Katiki Coast. These sites currently threaten the security of State Highway 1 along the Katiki Coast.

ProjectName: Walking and Cycling Facilities: Wellington to Hutt Valley Link Programme - Ngauranga to Petone
ProjectShortDescription: This project seeks to provide transport infrastructure that will improve safety and connectivity for walking and cycling between Wellington and the Hutt Valley. It aims to provide dedicated walking and cycling facilities. This project focusses on the Ngauranga to Petone section.

ProjectName: SH1 Improvements - Papakura to Bombay
ProjectShortDescription: This project is to make improvements to SH1 between Papakura and Bombay. The south is the largest future urban growth area in Auckland with around 5000 hectares of land identified for urban development across South Auckland. Improvements to SH1 from Papakura to Bombay is a priority within the Supporting Growth Programme.

ProjectName: Cycling and Pedestrian Facilities including Safety Improvements - SH88
ProjectShortDescription: This project is to implement various options for safety improvements along the seven kilometres of the SH88 corridor. This includes a combination of improved delineation (e.g. audio tactile profiled road markings) and wire rope and w-section guardrail barriers. This project will also see the completion of the final section of the SH88 shared walking and cycling path from Dunedin (St Leonards) to Port Chalmers.

ProjectName: Corridor Improvements - SH10 Waipapa
ProjectShortDescription: This project is funded by the Provincial Growth Fund. The project includes intersection improvements to address delays on exit from Waipapa Road and access to Waipapa Commercial Centre. This project is part of the Waipapa Road Intersection Improvements project.

ProjectName: Bridge Replacement - SH26 Kirikiri Stream
ProjectShortDescription: This project is to replace the bridge structure in order to reduce flooding issues associated with a central pier and inadequate waterway under the bridge. This work also includes a nearby intersection improvement (SH26/25A) to ensure safe sight distance to the new bridge.

ProjectName: Safety Improvements - SH16 Brigham Creek to Waimauku
ProjectShortDescription: This project seeks to deliver Safer Corridor treatments such as median and side barrier and roundabouts and/or grade separation within the Safe System (harm minimisation) limits.

ProjectName: Waimakariri Bluffs Rock protection
ProjectShortDescription: This project will deliver increased route resilience. It includes rock scaling at Paddys Bend with design and installation of a 2000 kJ 4 to 5 metre high attenuator. It also includes rock scaling at Waimakariri Bluffs with mesh and bolt (throated drape) rockfall mitigation system.

ProjectName: Bridge Upgrade - SH10 Kaeo Bridge
ProjectShortDescription: This project is to upgrade the existing one lane and one way Kaeo bridge to be two lanes.

ProjectName: Route Realignment - Waikare Gorge
ProjectShortDescription: This project is a route realignment at Waikare Gorge. Funding for this project is from the Provincial Growth Fund.

ProjectName: Safety and Resilience Improvements - SH11 Kawakawa to SH10
ProjectShortDescription: This project is to deliver Safety and Resilience Improvements to SH11 Kawakawa to SH10. This corridor provides the connection between SH1 and the Bay of Islands. It is a critical tourism route and suffers from flooding and slip problems in addition to safety problems. This project is an amalgamation of both safety and resilience activities that have overlapping geographical locations along this corridor. This project seeks to deliver safer corridor treatments such as median and side barriers; roundabouts or grade separation or speed management within Safe System (harm minimisation) limits. The project also includes resilience improvements on SH11 to address flooding problems.

ProjectName: Improvements Across SH12 - Rawene to Waipoua
ProjectShortDescription: This is a project funded by the Provincial Growth Fund. The outcomes sought include seasonal diversification and resilient and safe access. It also seeks better integration of SH12 with Omapere and Opononi. The project will likely focus on creating a transport system that supports new and existing visitor attractions. It will also likely focus on slips and road safety which also includes integration of coastal erosion measures and movement within townships and township plans.

ProjectName: Resilience Improvements - SH35 and Connecting Routes
ProjectShortDescription: This project is funded by the Provincial Growth Fund. The project is to complete resilience improvements targeted at route security and network availability issues on SH35. It also includes managing slope stability issues.

ProjectName: Passing Opportunities - SH35 and Connecting Routes
ProjectShortDescription: This project will create passing opportunities in which 21 no passing opportunities will be targeted on the State Highway network. These improvements support improved journey time and route reliability for inter and intra-regional journeys for communities and industry within the region. Opportunities to pass include three opportunities along SH2 Gisborne to Opotiki; twelve opportunities along SH2 Gisborne to Napier and six opportunities along SH35.

ProjectName: State Highway Improvements - SH43 Forgotten World Highway
ProjectShortDescription: This project is funded by the Provincial Growth Fund. This project is a Single Stage Business Case to understand the best approach to improvements along the SH43 corridor with a focus on sealing the 12 kilometre unsealed section of the corridor. Included in the scope is consideration of the entire SH43 corridor as it may benefit from enhanced safety and resilience upgrades to ensure that the highway is able to provide a viable alternative route should SH3 north (New Plymouth - Te Kuiti) be closed.

ProjectName: Wellington to Hutt Valley Walking and Cycling Link Programme - Petone to Melling
ProjectShortDescription: This project seeks to provide transport infrastructure that will improve safety and connectivity for walking and cycling between Wellington and Hutt Valley. It aims to provide dedicated walking and cycling facilities. This is the Petone to Melling section.

ProjectName: 20Connect (SH20B)  Southwest Auckland
ProjectShortDescription: This project includes the following activities: Increasing capacity on SH20B and SH20 between SH20A and SH1 increased capacity. Improving the southern bound motorway link between SH20A and SH20. Allowing for mass transit between Mangere and Botany via Manukau. Upgrading the Puhinui Rail Station interchange. Increasing public transport service frequency, geographic coverage, priority and infrastructure. Developing a mobility as a service marketplace. Completing a demand management campaign and supporting initiatives.

ProjectName: Enabling Works - SH18 Squadron Drive Improvements
ProjectShortDescription: This project will construct efficiency improvements and new west facing access.

ProjectName: Interventions to Improve Access to Central New Zealand - SH3 Napier
ProjectShortDescription: This project is to refine and develop interventions for the three intersections of Roberts Line; James Line and Stoney Creek Road along SH3 (Napier Road). These interventions will improve the safety and efficiency of the transport network.

ProjectName: Resilience Improvements - SH60 Takaka Hill
ProjectShortDescription: This project is to construct resilience improvements along the SH60 Takaka Hill corridor. This corridor has seen prolonged loss of connectivity following significant weather events.

ProjectName: Bridge Replacement - SH7 Ahaura River
ProjectShortDescription: Ahaura Bridge (built in 1929) is a one lane timber bridge located on SH7 immediately south of Ahaura Township. Numerous components of the bridge are heavily decayed and on-going regular inspection and maintenance is necessary. This replacement bridge project is signalled as necessary within the next four to six years as part of the National Bridge Replacement Programme. The Ahaura Bridge is at the end of its life and is at risk of failing due to undetected decay and the general strength and condition of the bridge.

ProjectName: SH30A Urban Revitalisation - Connect Rotorua
ProjectShortDescription: This project is part of the Connect Rotorua programme of work. This project will deliver SH30A Amohau Street network changes and form or function for revocation.

ProjectName: Bridge Replacement - SH8 Beaumont Bridge
ProjectShortDescription: This project is the replacement of the Beaumont Bridge. The existing bridge is 136 years old and consists of composite wrought iron trusses supporting a timber deck and is at the end of life. The project scope is likely to require notable realignment and reconfiguration of local road connectivity regardless of option.

ProjectName: Bridge Replacement - SH30 Kopaki Bridge
ProjectShortDescription: Kopaki Bridge is at the end of its life. This project will both replace the Bridge and enable high productivity motor vehicle movements.

ProjectName: Corridor Improvements - SH6A
ProjectShortDescription: This project will deliver corridor improvements to relieve congestion and ease access from side roads.

ProjectName: Bridge Corridor Improvements - Stage 2 - SH6 Grant Road to Kawarau Bridge
ProjectShortDescription: Work necessary to compliment development projects in the area including improvements for pedestrians, lighting, widening and utility integration. Includes surrounding projects for Glenda Drive, Frankton BP road access improvements and BP road access to Kawarau Falls Bridge Corridor Improvements.

ProjectName: SH1 Taupo to Waiouru Safety Improvements
ProjectShortDescription: This project will deliver corridor wide safety, journey and resilience improvements from Taupo through to Waiouru including replacement of Tauranga-Taupo Bridge.

ProjectName: City Centre to Mangere Light Rail  Auckland
ProjectShortDescription: This project is to construct a light rail from the Auckland City Centre to Mangere. The project will connect communities and unlock significant growth potential along the corridor. This project will also alleviate current and forecast bus capacity constraints in the city centre.

ProjectName: Resilience Improvements - SH7 Sylvia Flat
ProjectShortDescription: SH7 is a key freight and tourist route in the South Island. The Lewis River currently threatens cutting into SH7 at Sylvia Flat (near the Boyle River). This project is to realign part of SH7 to be at safe distance from the River. The preferred option is to construct a new section of highway 200 metres long and 30 metres back from the top of the scarp. This would maintain the slope from the actual toe of the bank and not be reliant on talus material for longevity.

ProjectName: Safer Corridor Improvements  Stage 2  SH3 Awakino to Mount Messenger Corridor
ProjectShortDescription: This project will deliver Safer Corridor treatments such as median and side barriers; roundabouts or grade separation and/or speed management. All these treatments are within Safe System (harm minimisation) limits.

ProjectName: SH16/18 Connection and Interchange Upgrades  Auckland
ProjectShortDescription: This project is to improve SH16/18 motorway connections and interchange upgrades at Brigham Creek and Northside Drive.

ProjectName: Safety Improvements  SH3A Waitara to Bell Block
ProjectShortDescription: This project is to help improve road safety and reduce crashes. The project will also ease congestion. Road improvements on SH3 between Waitara to Bell Block include a focus on roads and roadsides as well as intersections. It also includes closing some side roads and restricting movements on others where possible.

ProjectName: SeaPath Walking and Cycling Connection  Auckland
ProjectShortDescription: This project is for the provision of a 3.4 kilometre shared path between Esmonde Road and Auckland Harbour Bridge/Northcote Point. It includes potential linkages with the proposed SkyPath project or walking and cycling facilities that would be included with the Additional Waitemata Harbour Crossing across the Auckland Harbour Bridge or the ferry that operates between the Northcote Point Wharf and Auckland CBD.

ProjectName: Low Cost Low Risk Road Improvements across New Zealand
ProjectShortDescription: This project is the delivery of a suite of low cost low risk improvements across New Zealand roads.

ProjectName: Walking and Cycling Facilities  Auckland Harbour Bridge
ProjectShortDescription: This project is the provision of a walking and cycling connection from Auckland City to the Northshore across the Auckland Harbour Bridge.

ProjectName: Ashhurst Bore to Reservoir Pipe Replacement Project
ProjectShortDescription: This project will replace the waterpipe from the Ashhurst bore to the reservoir. The delivery of this horizontal infrastructure will support housing and urban growth.

ProjectName: Ashhurst Road Improvements Projects
ProjectShortDescription: This project includes a number of road upgrades and improvements in Ashhurst including: Wyndham Street upgrade (Cambridge to Oxford); Custom Street improvements; Oxford Street improvements (Wyndham to North Street including Colyton Intersection). These upgrades will be delivered as individual projects.

ProjectName: Ashhurst Wastewater Network Upgrade - North St
ProjectShortDescription: This project is responsible for delivering wastewater network upgrades at North Street in Ashhurst. This project will deliver the horizontal infrastructure required to support housing and urban growth.

ProjectName: Ashhurst Water supply upgrade Project
ProjectShortDescription: This project aims to upgrade the Ashhurst water supply to address fire fighting shortfalls and to cater for growth.

ProjectName: Bunnythorpe Community Centre
ProjectShortDescription: This project will deliver a new community hall in Bunnythorpe.

ProjectName: Bunnythorpe to Kelvin Grove Water Pipeline Project
ProjectShortDescription: This project will deliver the construction of a water pipeline from Bunnythorpe into the Kelvin Grove Zone. The delivery of this horizontal infrastructure will support housing and urban growth.

ProjectName: Central Energy Trust Arena Manawatu New Southern Stand Project
ProjectShortDescription: This project seeks to deliver a new grandstand and associated facilities at the Central Energy Trust Arena. This project is subject to partial external funding.

ProjectName: Central Energy Trust Arena Manawatu Priority 2 Projects
ProjectShortDescription: This project looks to complete Masterplan Priority 2 Projects at the Central Energy Trust Arena. This project includes embankment remodelling; new facilities; and other investments in the Central Energy Trust Arena.

ProjectName: Central Energy Trust Arena Manawatu Priority 3 Projects
ProjectShortDescription: This project looks to complete Masterplan Priority 3 Projects at the Central Energy Trust Arena. This project includes embankment remodelling; new facilities; and other investments in the Central Energy Trust Arena.

ProjectName: Central Energy Trust Arena Renewal and Replacements Project
ProjectShortDescription: This project includes a number of distinctive replacements and renewal projects at the Central Energy Trust Arena including: replacement of equipment; combined asset refurbishment; and the replacement of the Arena big screen.

ProjectName: Cultural Facilities Redevelopment Project
ProjectShortDescription: This project includes the replacement of structures; internal fit out and services of council owned cultural facilities. This project will be delivered over the next ten years.

ProjectName: Cycle and Pedestrian Pathway - Palmerston North to Bunnythorpe
ProjectShortDescription: This project will improve pedestrian and cycling linkages across the Manawatu River; Victoria Esplanade; and other amenity areas.

ProjectName: North East Industrial Zone Water Supply Systems Installation Project - Palmerston North
ProjectShortDescription: The purpose of this project is to develop the required water supply systems and associated horizontal infrastructure to enable and support urban growth in the North East Industrial Zone in Palmerston North.

ProjectName: Palmerston North Active and Public Transport Projects
ProjectShortDescription: This project is comprised of a number of citywide projects including: new cycle stands and shelters; bus stop improvements; street seats; and cycle phases at intersections. These projects are expected to be implemented over the next 10 years. It is anticipated these projects will be procured in bundled packages.

ProjectName: Palmerston North Additional Cycle Lane Development Project
ProjectShortDescription: The purpose of this project is to develop additional cycle lanes across the city over the next ten years.

ProjectName: Palmerston North Additional Social Housing Unit Development

ProjectShortDescription: This project is to renew the Howick Loop transmission watermain.

ProjectName: Maybury Gravity Pipeline Upgrade - Tamaki
ProjectShortDescription: This project is to upgrade 760 metres of 300/400 millimetre diameter pipeline with a 525 millimetre diameter pipeline.

ProjectName: Modifications to Increase Water Resilience - Ardmore Water Treatment Plant
ProjectShortDescription: This project will enable modifications to the Ardmore Water Treatment Plant to allow separation into two separate process streams increasing resilience.

ProjectName: Network Upgrade to Address Capacity Constraints - St Heliers
ProjectShortDescription: This project addresses existing capacity constraints and will provide additional capacity to service future growth. It includes construction of a new 200 litre per second pump station. It also includes a new 1050 metres of 200 millimetre diameter rising main and 650 metres of 355 millimetre diameter gravity sewer.

ProjectName: New Fifty Megalitre Reservoir Expansion - Redoubt Road Reservoir Complex
ProjectShortDescription: This project is the construction of a new 50 megalitre reservoir at the Redoubt Road reservoir complex.

ProjectName: New Gravity Sewer for Increased Capacity - Torbay
ProjectShortDescription: This project is to increase capacity in the Torbay catchment. The current option consists of 1.8 kilometres of 300/450 millimetres diameter gravity sewer.

ProjectName: New Khyber Pass Reservoir
ProjectShortDescription: This project is to construct a new 12.5 megalitre reservoir in the Khyber Pass Reservoir complex.

ProjectName: New Micro-Tunnelled Pipeline for Wastewater Diversion - Queen Street
ProjectShortDescription: This project will provide 800 metres of 450 millimetre diameter micro-tunnelled pipeline to provide for growth and divert wastewater flows from a suspended sewer.

ProjectName: New North Harbour Number Two Watermain
ProjectShortDescription: This project is to construct the new North Harbour Number 2 Two watermain to service approximately 200000 people which will connect Greenhithe Bridge and Albany Reservoirs. This project includes approximately 10 kilometres of 900 millimetre diameter concrete lined steel pipework.

ProjectName: New Pipeline for Sunnybrae Branch Diversion - Hillcrest
ProjectShortDescription: This project is to divert part of the Sunnybrae Branch Sewer and includes approximately 1.6 kilometres of 300 millimetre diameter pipeline.

ProjectName: New Pump and Pump Station Electrical Upgrade - New Lynn
ProjectShortDescription: This project includes the installation of an additional pump and electrical infrastructure upgrade to increase the performance at the New Lynn Pump Station.

ProjectName: New Pump Station - Waikato
ProjectShortDescription: This project is to construct a new 2300 litre per second water pump station to boost pumping at the Waikato One watermain between the Waikato Water Treatment Plant and Redoubt Road reservoirs. The project includes approximately 100 metres of 1200 millimetre diameter pipeline being installed.

ProjectName: New Pump Station and Trunk Sewer Upgrade - Pukekohe
ProjectShortDescription: This project is the construction of a new 200 litres per second pump station. It also includes 1.6 kilometre of 450 millimetre diameter rising main and 1.8 kilometre of 475 millimetre diameter gravity pipeline.

ProjectName: New Sludge Conditioning Process Construction - Mangere
ProjectShortDescription: This project is to construct a new sludge conditioning process prior to digesters such as thermal hydrolysis. This will increase generated power from 55 per cent to 80 per cent along with improved dewatering of biosolids producing a Class A product.

ProjectName: New Water Infrastructure to Service Tamaki - HLC Tamaki Regeneration Company
ProjectShortDescription: This project will cater for population growth in the Tamaki regeneration area. It includes three watermain pipes the first 5.2 kilometres of 250 millimetre diameter. The remaining two are 900 metres of 350 millimetre diameter watermain and 800 metres of 200 millimetre diameter watermain.

ProjectName: New Water Treatment Plant - Hays Creek
ProjectShortDescription: This project involves constructing a new seven million litre per day package water treatment plant that utilises the Hays Creek Dam source in Papakura.

ProjectName: New Watermain Connecting Woodlands Park Reservoirs to Greenhithe Bridge
ProjectShortDescription: This project will see the construction of a new watermain to service approximately 200000 people connecting the proposed Woodlands Park reservoirs to Greenhithe Bridge. It includes approximately 22 kilometres of 1200 millimetre diameter concrete lines steel pipework.

ProjectName: North Harbour No. 2 Watermain Installation  Early Works
ProjectShortDescription: As part of the wider Western Water Supply Strategy Watercare are planning to install a new pipeline from Auckland's western water sources in the Waitakere Ranges to west Auckland to North Shore and Rodney. This project is for the design and early works stages including crossing a NZTA transport corridor and a rail crossing.

ProjectName: North Harbour Water Main Duplication - Greenhithe Bridge
ProjectShortDescription: This project is to cater for growth on the North Shore and in North Auckland. It consists of 2.5 kilometres of 1200 millimetre diameter concrete lines steel pipework for the new North Harbour 2 watermain Greenhithe Bridge section.

ProjectName: Orewa Number 1 Watermain Replacement - Stage 3
ProjectShortDescription: This project is for the renewal of the Orewa 1 concrete lined steel watermain (4.6 kilometres and 507 millimetres in diameter) from Hibiscus Coast Highway through to the connection with Maire Road Reservoir.

ProjectName: Pipeline Installation for Growth Servicing - Warkworth
ProjectShortDescription: This project is to provide for greenfield growth in Warkworth. A 1.2 kilometre (300 millimetre diameter) pipeline from the Warkworth Showground to Elizabeth Street will be installed. The project also includes a new 450 millimetre diameter pipe bridge crossing and upgrading a 300 metre pipeline from 225 millimetres to 450 millimetres in diameter.

ProjectName: Pump Station 14 and Associated Infrastructure Upgrade - Tamaki
ProjectShortDescription: This project is to cater for growth in Tamaki. The project includes the upgrade of the Pump Station from 100 litres per second to 180 litres per second. The project also includes upgrading gravity pipelines feeding Pump Station 14 which includes 45 metres of 750 millimetre diameter sewer pipeline and 90 metres of 450 millimetre diameter sewer pipeline.

ProjectName: Pump Station and Rising Main Upgrade - Stanmore
ProjectShortDescription: This project includes various upgrades to the pump station and rising main in Stanmore.

ProjectName: Pump Station Replacement - Wairau Wastewater Pump Station
ProjectShortDescription: This project is to replace the existing Wairau Pump Station with a new pump station with a peak flow capacity of 1400 litres per second.

ProjectName: Raising Main Extension to Increase Pump Capacity - Kahika
ProjectShortDescription: This project is to increase pump capacity from Kahika Pump Station from 300 litres per second to 500 litres per second. The current option includes a 1.6 kilometre 600 millimetre diameter rising main.

ProjectName: Raw Water Pump Station Upgrade - Lower Nihotupu
ProjectShortDescription: This project is to increase the pump station capacity from 30 million litres per day to 40 million litres per day between Lower Nihotupu Dam and Mackies Rest which feeds onto the Huia Water Treatment Plant.

ProjectName: Raw Water Transmission Main Capacity Upgrade - Huia
ProjectShortDescription: This project is to improve the capacity of the raw water transmission watermain to 140 million litres per day between Mackies Rest and the new Huia Water Treatment Plant.

ProjectName: Replacement of East Coast Bays 2 Watermain
ProjectShortDescription: This project will replace 1.2 kilometres of 390 millimetre diameter concrete lined steel transmission watermain.

ProjectName: Replacement of Odour Beds with Trickling Filters - Mangere
ProjectShortDescription: This project is to replace existing odour beds with trickling filters. This project will improve the wastewater treatment plant odour.

ProjectName: Replacement of Rehabilitation of Orewa One Watermain - Silverdale West
ProjectShortDescription: This project is to replace and/or rehabilitate the Orewa One watermain to provide consistent service between Albany and the Maire Road reservoir and align with Silverdale West Water Servicing.

ProjectName: Rising Main Replacement - Kahika Pump Station
ProjectShortDescription: This project is for the replacement of the Kahika Pump Station rising main.

ProjectName: Security System Replacements
ProjectShortDescription: This project will upgrade the security and access systems on operational sites.

ProjectName: Sidmouth Wastewater Pump Station Upgrade - Mairangi Bay
ProjectShortDescription: This project is to upgrade the Sidmouth Wastewater Pump Station and storage tank. It includes a 625 litres per second pump station with an additional 200 cubic metres of integrated storage and a 160 metre (300 millimetre diameter) pipeline.

ProjectName: Transmission Sewer and Pump Station Construction - Redhills
ProjectShortDescription: This project is the construction of a transmission sewer and pump station to service growth in Redhills.

ProjectName: Transmission Watermain Pipeline - Northcote Reservoir to Glenfield
ProjectShortDescription: This project focuses on the transmission water pipeline between Northcote reservoir and Glenfield and includes approximately 1.7 kilometres of 300 millimetre diameter pipeline.

ProjectName: Trunk Sewer Development - Drury South
ProjectShortDescription: This project is to construct a new 130 litres per second package pump station with 1110 cubic metres of storage and approximately 1.5 kilometres of 450 millimetre diameter gravity sewer.

ProjectName: Upgrade of Existing Wastewater Network - HLC Mt Roskill/Owairaka
ProjectShortDescription: This project is to upgrade the existing local wastewater network. It includes a 1.5 kilometre (900 millimetre diameter) sewer pipeline and a 600 metre (600 millimetre diameter) sewer pipeline. A third 2.2 kilometre sewer pipeline from 300 to 475 and 525 millimetres in diameter will also be part of this wastewater improvement project.

ProjectName: Upgrade of Hingaia Wastewater Pump Station - Southern Auckland
ProjectShortDescription: This project will upgrade the Hingaia Wastewater Pump Station from a capacity of 100 litres per second to 270 litres per second. It will also provide an additional 450 cubic metre modular storage tank and construction of a 8.3 kilometre (630 millimetre diameter) rising main. This is then followed by a break pressure chamber with odour control.

ProjectName: Upgrade of Huia Water Treatment Plant
ProjectShortDescription: This project is to upgrade/replace the Huia Water Treatment Plant to improve the security of supply and ensure compliance with Drinking Standards New Zealand.

ProjectName: Upgrade of Ocean Outfall Pipeline - Warkworth and Snells Beach/Algies Bay Catchments
ProjectShortDescription: This project involves upgrading the outfall pipeline to cater for long term growth in the Warkworth and Snells Beach/Algies Bay catchments. The project includes the replacement of existing outfall with approximately 7.6 kilometres of 40 millimetre diameter outfall pipeline.

ProjectName: Upgrade of Pipework to Increase Capacity - Newton Road
ProjectShortDescription: This project will increase the capacity between Khyber Reservoirs and Ponsonby. It consists of upgrading one kilometre of 810 millimetre diameter concrete lined steel pipework in Newton Road Auckland.

ProjectName: Upgrade of Pump Station and Associated Network Upgrades - Orewa West
ProjectShortDescription: This project is to allow for population growth in Orewa West for the next 30 years. The project includes upgrading the Orewa West Pump Station and associated network.

ProjectName: Upgrade of the Waiuku Wastewater Treatment Plant and Wastewater Servicing to Clarks Beach
ProjectShortDescription: This project is to enable wastewater conveyance for 5000 people from Kingseat to Clarks Beach and 15000 people from Clarks Beach to the Waiuku Wastewater Treatment Plant. It includes the upgrade of the Waiuku Wastewater Treatment Plant for 20000 people (expandable to 30000) and a treated wastewater conveyance pipe to Clarks Beach in alignment with Watercare south-western discharge consent conditions.

ProjectName: Upgrades of Separation and Wastewater Pipes to Reduce Wet Weather Overflows - Avondale to Whau River
ProjectShortDescription: This programme of work is to enable growth and reduce wet weather overflows. The programme will involve a mix of sewer separation and wastewater pipe upgrades. It will also include collector pipes and inflow and infiltration works. This project is part of Watercare's Wastewater Catchment Improvement Works.

ProjectName: Upgrading Wastewater Pipes for Future Wastewater Servicing - Gulf Harbour
ProjectShortDescription: This project is to allow for population growth for the next 30 years. The project includes upgrading 1.5 kilometres of 200 millimetre diameter pipeline with 400 millimetre diameter pipeline.

ProjectName: Waitakere No 1 Watermain Upgrade
ProjectShortDescription: This project is to upgrade the Waitakere Number One watermain to account for expected growth. It includes 11 kilometres of 400 millimetre diameter pipeline.

ProjectName: Waiwera Diversion to Hatsfield Beach
ProjectShortDescription: This project is to provide a pump station that handles 20 litres per second. It also includes a 2.1 kilometre (180 millimetre diameter) rising main and a 2.5 kilometre (250 millimetre diameter) gravity sewer.

ProjectName: Wastewater Capacity Improvements Northern Interceptor - Stage 1 - North West Auckland
ProjectShortDescription: This project is to provide capacity to the developing North West Auckland area and divert flows from Mangere to Rosedale Wastewater Treatment Plant. The first phase is the construction of a nine kilometre rising main from Hobsonville to Rosedale. This project will be delivered in conjunction with the Greenhithe Bridge Watermain Duplication project.

ProjectName: Wastewater Capacity Upgrades - Otara Catchment
ProjectShortDescription: This project will deliver a new 400 litres per second pump station which will provide 500 cubic metres of tank storage. The project also includes a new 2500 cubic metre storage tank and 2.5 kilometres of 625 millimetre diameter relining and 1.8 kilometres of 625 millimetre diameter rising main.

ProjectName: Wastewater Catchment Diversion - Forrest Hill
ProjectShortDescription: This project is to upgrade the Forrest Hill network. It consists of a 1.1 kilometre (310 millimetre diameter) rising main and a 60 litres per second pump station. It also includes 350 metres of 250/335 millimetre diameter rising main and 600 metres of 300/375/525 millimetres diameter gravity sewer.

ProjectName: Wastewater Catchment Improvement Works - Waterview
ProjectShortDescription: This programme of work is to enable growth and reduce wet weather overflows. The programme will involve a mix of sewer separation and wastewater pipe upgrades. The programme also includes collector pipes and inflow and infiltration works.

ProjectName: Wastewater Catchment System Upgrades for Growth and Mitigation of Sewer Overflows- Howick
ProjectShortDescription: This project is to deliver new pump stations and associated network upgrades in Aviemore and Millhouse Parks to provide for growth and mitigate sewer overflows. Two 200 litre per second pump stations will be constructed along with 3.1 kilometres of 450 millimetres diameter rising mains and one kilometre of 600 diameter gravity sewer.

ProjectName: Wastewater Diversion - Unsworth Heights
ProjectShortDescription: This project will divert wastewater from the gravity main in Rosedale Park that drains from Unsworth Heights directly to the Rosedale Wastewater Treatment Plant inlet works. A new 45 litre per second pump station and 380 metres of 125 millimetre diameter rising main will be built as part of the project.

ProjectName: Wastewater Network Improvements - HLC Mangere
ProjectShortDescription: This project is to construct wastewater network upgrades required to convey flows from HLC Mangere development.

ProjectName: Wastewater Network Upgrades - Northcote to Chatswood
ProjectShortDescription: This project is to provide a new 60 litre per second pump station to service Northcote to Chatswood. The project also includes a 900 metre (315 millimetre diameter) rising main and a 700 metre (450 millimetre diameter) gravity pipeline.

ProjectName: Wastewater Odour Treatment Plant Expansion - Rosedale
ProjectShortDescription: This project will increase odour treatment capacity. It includes catering for the connection of the Northern Interceptor to service a peak population of 160000.

ProjectName: Wastewater Treatment Plant Biogas and Co-generation Expansion - Rosedale
ProjectShortDescription: This project is to construct upgrades to the biogas and co-generation facilities at Rosedale Wastewater Treatment Plant. This project will increase generated power from 65 per cent to 90 per cent.

ProjectName: Wastewater Treatment Plant Control Upgrade and Replacement - Rosedale
ProjectShortDescription: This project is a Control System upgrade and replacement at Rosedale Wastewater Treatment Plant.

ProjectName: Wastewater Treatment Plant Expansion Project - Rosedale
ProjectShortDescription: This project is to service population growth up to 320000 and a flow of 4.0 cubic metres per second. The expansion of the treatment plant includes a new primary settlement tank and secondary biological treatment reactor and new thermal hydrolysis plant.

ProjectName: Wastewater Treatment Plant Peak Flow Treatment Modifications - Mangere
ProjectShortDescription: This project will enable process modifications to allow for enhanced peak flow treatment.

ProjectName: Wastewater Treatment Plant Reactor/Clarifiers and Ultra Violet Expansion - Rosedale
ProjectShortDescription: This project includes upgrades to the reactor/clarifiers and ultra violet treatment at Rosedale.

ProjectName: Wastewater Treatment Plant Screens Replacement - Army Bay
ProjectShortDescription: This project is the replacement of ageing under-performing step screens with current technology.

ProjectName: Wastewater Treatment Plant Solids Stream Process Upgrade - Mangere
ProjectShortDescription: This project is to upgrade the solids stream process as part of the Mangere Wastewater Treatment Plant upgrades.

ProjectName: Wastewater Treatment Plant Upgrade - Army Bay
ProjectShortDescription: This project is to increase capacity of the wastewater treatment plant to meet a population growth of 100000 people.

ProjectName: Wastewater Treatment Plant Upgrade - Pukekohe
ProjectShortDescription: This project involves doubling the throughput capacity of the Pukekohe Wastewater Treatment Plant from 260 litres per second to 520 litres per second to service population growth.

ProjectName: Wastewater Treatment Plant Upgrade - Snells Beach
ProjectShortDescription: This project is to upgrade Snells Wastewater Treatment Plant to service growth in Warkworth to Snells Beach and Algies Bay.

ProjectName: Wastewater Treatment Plant Upgrade - Wellsford
ProjectShortDescription: This project is to upgrade the treatment plant to accommodate a population of approximately 4200 people over 30 years.

ProjectName: Water Servicing - HLC Oranga
ProjectShortDescription: This project will enable water trunk network upgrades to cater for population growth in Oranga.

ProjectName: Water Servicing Improvements - HLC Mt Roskill to Owairaka
ProjectShortDescription: This project is to improve water servicing from the HLC development in Mt Roskill to Owairaka to support growth in the area.

ProjectName: Water Servicing Infrastructure Upgrade for Capacity Improvements - Pukekohe
ProjectShortDescription: This project is to provide for growth in the north and west of Pukekohe. The project includes work on a reservoir and boost pump station. It also includes upgrading the trunk connection between Drury to Pukekohe.

ProjectName: Water Supply Upgrade - Pukekohe Area
ProjectShortDescription: This project will construct a bulk supply point and 1.5 kilometres of 300mm diameter polyethylene or concrete lined steel pipework to feed growth areas within Pukekohe.

ProjectName: Water Transmission Capacity Increase Hunua 4 Section 11 - Manukau to Auckland City
ProjectShortDescription: This project involves increasing the transmission capacity of the bulk network between the Redoubt Road reservoirs in Manukau and Khyber Pass reservoirs in Auckland City to meet the rising demand for water driven by population growth. The project includes installation of 4 kilometres of 1.5 metre diameter pipeline from Market Road to the Khyber Pass reservoir complex.

ProjectName: Water Treatment Plant Capacity Upgrade - Wellsford
ProjectShortDescription: This project is to upgrade the capacity of the existing Wellsford Water Treatment Plant to accommodate a population of approximately 4200 people over 30 years.

ProjectName: Water Treatment Plant Interim Upgrade - Waitakere
ProjectShortDescription: This project will replace various parts of the Waitakere Water Treatment Plant which are in poor condition and require replacement ahead of a major plant upgrade.

ProjectName: Water Treatment Plant Process Improvements - Onehunga
ProjectShortDescription: This project is for the installation of an additional process unit or units (granulated activated carbon and or advanced oxidation) to address the removal of organic pollutants.

ProjectName: Water Treatment Plant Upgrade for Increased Capacity - Waiuku
ProjectShortDescription: This project is to upgrade the Waiuku Water Treatment Plant to increase capacity to 2.5 million litres per day and associated connectivity to the existing network.

ProjectName: Watermain Boost Pumping - West Auckland
ProjectShortDescription: This project will increase water conveyance from southern sources via Huia Watermain 2 to North Harbour 1 Watermain Water pump station. The project will provide security of supply to the Huia Water Treatment Plant.

ProjectName: Watermains Boost Pumping for Increased Capacity - Westhaven
ProjectShortDescription: This project is to boost pumping of the North Shore 1 and 2 watermains increasing capacity from 40 million litres per day to 90 million litres per day.

ProjectName: Woodlands Watermain to Titirangi Reservoir Capacity Improvements
ProjectShortDescription: This project is to improve the pipe tunnelled between Huia Water Treatment Plant and Titirangi Reservoir to provide 30 million litres per day capacity.

ProjectName: Bulk Water Pipe Bridge Upgrade - Silverstream
ProjectShortDescription: This project is the replacement of the bulk water pipe bridge over the Hutt River to improve reliability and resilience of the network.

ProjectName: Cross Harbour Pipeline Construction - Wellington Eastern Suburbs to Waterloo
ProjectShortDescription: This project is to construct a pipeline between the Waterloo Water Treatment Plant and Wellington's eastern suburbs to provide network resilience.

ProjectName: Plant Design and Build for Sludge Minimisation - Southern Landfill and Recycle Centre Wellington
ProjectShortDescription: This project is to design and build a plant to reduce the volume of biosolids (sludge) being disposed of at the landfill site.

ProjectName: Reservoir Construction - Aotea Porirua
ProjectShortDescription: This project is the construction of a reservoir to accommodate future growth and provide seismic and operational resilience.

ProjectName: Reservoir Construction - Moe-i-te-Ra Wellington
ProjectShortDescription: This project is the construction of a large buried reservoir and associated pipelines to accommodate future growth and provide seismic and operational resilience.

ProjectName: Reservoir Construction - Omaroro Wellington
ProjectShortDescription: This project is the construction of a large buried reservoir and associated pipelines to accommodate future growth and provide seismic and operational resilience.

ProjectName: Stormwater Network Improvements - Stage 2 - Kilbirnie
ProjectShortDescription: This project is to improve stormwater infrastructure to provide flood protection for vulnerable properties.

ProjectName: Stream Improvements for Flood Protection - Pinehaven Upper Hutt
ProjectShortDescription: This project is to make improvements to the Pinehaven stream to protect flood prone properties in the area.
